decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By playing low-cost threats like Delver of Secrets, Sprite Dragon, and Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to apply early pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. With a mix of card draw and removal spells, the deck can maintain tempo and control the pace of the game, ultimately securing victory through fast and decisive plays.

The main idea of this deck is to generate a lot of mana quickly by playing multiple elves, tapping them for mana, and using cards like Glimpse of Nature to draw through the deck. This allows the player to find key cards such as Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order to quickly assemble a game-winning combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board state and finish them off in one explosive turn. It focuses on speed, efficiency, and synergy between different elf cards to execute its combo strategy successfully.

The deck focuses on rapidly filling the graveyard with Dredge cards to power out a quick combo or overwhelming board presence. It utilizes cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to continuously mill cards into the graveyard, while cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy take advantage of creatures being put into the graveyard. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study to filter through the deck, the player can quickly assemble their combo pieces and overwhelm their opponent with a powerful board state.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their strategy with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and tempo plays with cards like Brazen Borrower. By manipulating the top of their deck with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm, the deck can ensure consistency and maximize its chances of winning the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's proactive game plan and maximize its efficiency.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Fireflux Squad, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Legion Warboss while disrupting their mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void. By using fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, as well as powerful lock pieces like Trinisphere, the deck aims to control the game and outpace the opponent with its powerful creature base and disruptive elements, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Mystic Forge and various artifact cards like Basalt Monolith, Voltaic Key, and Lion's Eye Diamond. By generating mana and untapping artifacts, the player can use Mystic Forge to cast cards from the top of their library for free, allowing them to chain through their deck and potentially win the game in a single turn. Additional cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Defense Grid provide disruption and protection for the combo to go off smoothly.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lands as both a resource and disruptive element to control the game. By utilizing Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation, the deck can consistently find key lands like Dark Depths and Valakut Exploration. Punishing Fire provides a recurring removal option while cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating multiple land drops per turn with Exploration and Mox Diamond and eventually overwhelm them with powerful land synergies.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine using cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier. This allows the player to bring back powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine from the graveyard for little to no cost. Additionally, using Altar of Dementia to sacrifice creatures can trigger abilities like Bridge from Below to generate zombie tokens. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless combo strategy.

The deck revolves around utilizing Food Chain to create a loop with Misthollow Griffin or Squee, the Immortal to generate infinite mana and cast Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath or Walking Ballista for the win. The deck also includes ways to tutor for combo pieces such as Imperial Recruiter and Manipulate Fate, with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards. Control elements like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt provide protection and disruption, while the mana base supports the deck's multicolored requirements for consistency.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the powerful Death's Shadow creature alongside other aggressive threats to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The deck includes a range of cantrips and disruptive spells to control the game and protect its key threats. The use of cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize help to lower the player's own life total to make Death's Shadow even more potent. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's various color requirements and disruptive strategies.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo using cards like Thespian's Stage and Crop Rotation. It also utilizes cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Elvish Reclaimer to search for key lands and provide additional utility. The deck includes a mix of lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt opponents, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay for interaction. The main strategy is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo to create a powerful 20/20 indestructible creature token and win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly placing low-cost creatures on the field and using abilities to deal direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Baleful Strix, Ornithopter, and Ingenious Infiltrator allows for easy card draw and evasion. Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow's ability to reveal cards from the top of the library means extra damage for every expensive card revealed. Control elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will help protect the strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression and disrupt their game plan.

This deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to find and equip powerful equipment like Batterskull, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to further control the board and card advantage. Overall, the goal is to out-value and out-control the opponent while deploying threats that are difficult for the opponent to deal with effectively.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. With a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with versatile creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the board while generating incremental advantages through card draw and recursion. By managing the opponent's threats and resources, the deck seeks to grind out value and eventually overpower the opponent with its superior late-game options.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to apply pressure with cheap and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Stifle and Wasteland to control the opponent's resources. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting its spells, making it a formidable aggro deck in the Legacy format.

This Grixis Aggro deck aims to win quickly by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis. It uses disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to protect its threats and control the game. The deck also includes a suite of cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. With access to powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, as well as mana denial with Wasteland, this deck seeks to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
